claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.

verified_evidence.quote: RIV4 is an unadjuvanted vaccine containing 45 µg of HA/dose from each of the four strains.
verified_evidence.explanation: A very close version of the quote appears in the document: 'RIV4 is an unadjuvanted vaccine containing 45 µg of HA/dose from each of the four strains.' This matches the quote to verify, with only minor differences in punctuation and word order (e.g., 'an unadjuvanted vaccine' instead of 'unadjuvanted vaccine').. The quote directly states that RIV4 (Flublok) contains 45 µg of HA per strain, and since standard-dose flu vaccines contain 15 µg of HA per strain, this is three times the amount. This fact substantiates the first part of the claim. The document also discusses that higher HA content and unique features of RIV4 are linked to greater immunogenicity compared to standard-dose vaccines, supporting the second part of the claim.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: A very close version of the quote appears in the document: 'RIV4 is an unadjuvanted vaccine containing 45 µg of HA/dose from each of the four strains.' This matches the quote to verify, with only minor differences in punctuation and word order (e.g., 'an unadjuvanted vaccine' instead of 'unadjuvanted vaccine').
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote directly states that RIV4 (Flublok) contains 45 µg of HA per strain, and since standard-dose flu vaccines contain 15 µg of HA per strain, this is three times the amount. This fact substantiates the first part of the claim. The document also discusses that higher HA content and unique features of RIV4 are linked to greater immunogenicity compared to standard-dose vaccines, supporting the second part of the claim.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote specifies the HA antigen content per strain in Flublok (RIV4), which is 45 µg, three times the standard 15 µg per strain in standard-dose flu vaccines.

verified_evidence.quote: illness and influenza like illness to a quadrivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (QIV; Fluarix Quadrivalent, GlaxoSmithKline) given at 15 µg dose strain in adults aged 18 to 64 years 37.
verified_evidence.explanation: A very similar quote appears on page 3: 'illness and influenza like illness to a quad rival ent in activated influenza vaccine (QIV; Fluarix Quad rival ent, Glaxo smith kline) given at 15 µg dose strain in adults aged 18 to 64 years 37.' The wording and content match the quote to verify, with only minor differences in spacing and hyphenation (e.g., 'quad rival ent' instead of 'quadrivalent'). The essential information is present: QIV (Fluarix Quadrivalent) is given at 15 µg HA per strain.. The quote directly states that the standard-dose quadrivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (QIV; Fluarix Quadrivalent) is given at 15 µg HA per strain. This supports the claim by establishing the HA content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which can then be compared to Flublok's 45 µg per strain (as described elsewhere in the document). This substantiates the '3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content' part of the claim. The document also discusses greater immunogenicity of Flublok elsewhere, so this quote is relevant and supportive for the claim as stated.

verified_evidence.quote: Higher magnitudes of haemagglutination inhibitory antibody response against HA1 have also been observed with RIV4 compared to egg- or mammalian cell derived split vaccines (Flucelvax Tetra, Seqirus, and Fluzone quadrivalent SD, Sanofi Pasteur 60.
verified_evidence.explanation: A very similar quote appears on page 5: 'Higher magnitudes of haemagglutination inhibitory antibody response against HA1 have also been observed with RIV4 compared to egg- or mammalian cell derived split vaccines (Flucelvax Tetra, Seqirus, and Fluzone quadrivalent SD, Sanofi Pasteur 60.' The wording is nearly identical to the quote to verify, with only minor differences in punctuation and formatting.. The quote directly states that RIV4 (Flublok) elicits higher magnitudes of hemagglutination inhibitory antibody responses against HA1 compared to standard-dose split vaccines derived from egg or mammalian cells. This supports the claim that Flublok's higher HA content is linked to greater immunogenicity versus standard-dose flu vaccines, as it provides evidence of a stronger immune response (immunogenicity) with RIV4.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: A very similar quote appears on page 5: 'Higher magnitudes of haemagglutination inhibitory antibody response against HA1 have also been observed with RIV4 compared to egg- or mammalian cell derived split vaccines (Flucelvax Tetra, Seqirus, and Fluzone quadrivalent SD, Sanofi Pasteur 60.' The wording is nearly identical to the quote to verify, with only minor differences in punctuation and formatting.
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote directly states that RIV4 (Flublok) elicits higher magnitudes of hemagglutination inhibitory antibody responses against HA1 compared to standard-dose split vaccines derived from egg or mammalian cells. This supports the claim that Flublok's higher HA content is linked to greater immunogenicity versus standard-dose flu vaccines, as it provides evidence of a stronger immune response (immunogenicity) with RIV4.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote directly states that RIV4 (Flublok) produces higher antibody responses than standard-dose flu vaccines, supporting the link between higher HA content and greater immunogenicity.

verified_evidence.quote: RIV4 elicited the most robust responses, with significantly higher T-cell and antibody levels than the other two vaccines. Authors postulated that simpler glycosylation of rHA and absence of other influenza viral proteins in RIV4 contributed to the observed robust immune response for RIV4 and emphasised the relevance of these features in determining vaccine efficacy and long term immunity 65.
verified_evidence.explanation: A very close version of the quote appears on page 5: 'Recently Richards et al.65 examined CD4 T-cell and antibody responses in healthy adults who received egg derived split vaccine, cell derived split vaccine or RIV4 for three successive influenza seasons (2015-2016, 2016-2017, and 2017-2018 65. RIV4 elicited the most robust responses, with significantly higher T-cell and antibody levels than the other two vaccines. Authors postulated that simpler glycosyla- tion of rHA and absence of other influenza viral proteins in RIV4 contributed to the observed robust immune response for RIV4 and emphasised the relevance of these features in determining vaccine efficacy and long term immunity 65.' The wording is nearly identical to the quote to verify, with only minor formatting and line breaks.. The quote directly supports the part of the claim that RIV4 (Flublok) is linked to greater immunogenicity compared to standard-dose flu vaccines, as it states that RIV4 elicited 'significantly higher T-cell and antibody levels than the other two vaccines' (which are standard-dose, egg- and cell-derived split vaccines). It also discusses possible reasons for this increased immunogenicity. However, the quote does not mention the 3x HA antigen content or directly link the higher antigen content to the greater immunogenicity. It only supports the immunogenicity comparison, not the antigen content aspect. Thus, it partially but genuinely supports the claim as written.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: A very close version of the quote appears on page 5: 'Recently Richards et al.65 examined CD4 T-cell and antibody responses in healthy adults who received egg derived split vaccine, cell derived split vaccine or RIV4 for three successive influenza seasons (2015-2016, 2016-2017, and 2017-2018 65. RIV4 elicited the most robust responses, with significantly higher T-cell and antibody levels than the other two vaccines. Authors postulated that simpler glycosyla- tion of rHA and absence of other influenza viral proteins in RIV4 contributed to the observed robust immune response for RIV4 and emphasised the relevance of these features in determining vaccine efficacy and long term immunity 65.' The wording is nearly identical to the quote to verify, with only minor formatting and line breaks.
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote directly supports the part of the claim that RIV4 (Flublok) is linked to greater immunogenicity compared to standard-dose flu vaccines, as it states that RIV4 elicited 'significantly higher T-cell and antibody levels than the other two vaccines' (which are standard-dose, egg- and cell-derived split vaccines). It also discusses possible reasons for this increased immunogenicity. However, the quote does not mention the 3x HA antigen content or directly link the higher antigen content to the greater immunogenicity. It only supports the immunogenicity comparison, not the antigen content aspect. Thus, it partially but genuinely supports the claim as written.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote directly supports the claim that RIV4 (Flublok) is linked to greater immunogenicity compared to standard-dose flu vaccines, referencing higher immune responses.

verified_evidence.quote: The post vaccination geometric mean fold rise against the two circulating viruses was twice as high for RIV4 as for HD-IIV3 or aIIV3.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote appears on page 5: 'The post vaccination geometric mean fold rise against the two circulating viruses was twice as high for RIV4 as for HD-IIV3 or aIIV3.' This matches the quote to verify, with only minor differences in punctuation and formatting.. The quote directly compares the immune response (geometric mean fold rise) after vaccination with RIV4 (Flublok) to that of high-dose and adjuvanted standard vaccines, showing that RIV4 elicits a higher response. This supports the claim that Flublok is linked to greater immunogenicity versus standard-dose flu vaccines. While the quote does not mention the 3x HA antigen content, it does substantiate the part of the claim regarding greater immunogenicity.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: The quote appears on page 5: 'The post vaccination geometric mean fold rise against the two circulating viruses was twice as high for RIV4 as for HD-IIV3 or aIIV3.' This matches the quote to verify, with only minor differences in punctuation and formatting.
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote directly compares the immune response (geometric mean fold rise) after vaccination with RIV4 (Flublok) to that of high-dose and adjuvanted standard vaccines, showing that RIV4 elicits a higher response. This supports the claim that Flublok is linked to greater immunogenicity versus standard-dose flu vaccines. While the quote does not mention the 3x HA antigen content, it does substantiate the part of the claim regarding greater immunogenicity.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote provides direct comparative data showing that RIV4 (Flublok) produces a higher immune response than other flu vaccines, supporting the claim of greater immunogenicity.
